alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell; Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 2:08AM MST until February 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED TOMORROW... .A winter storm will impact the area today and tonight, bringing heavy snow to portions of the northern Black Hills and foothills, along with much of northeastern Wyoming. On the northwestern and west central South Dakota plains, strong winds and snow will lead to slippery roads and reduced visibilities, causing travel difficulties. Snow is expected to taper off from northwest to southeast tomorrow evening into the night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County and Western Crook County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
